description: A folk word, first attested in c. 1600s, apparently from a Norfolk dialect, of uncertain origin. Perhaps from some Low German word or from dialectal dump (“lump”) (first attested in the late 1800s),  +‎ -ling (diminutive suffix).

definitionGroups.group: (cooking) A ball of dough that is cooked and may have a filling and/or additional ingredients in the dough. [from 17th c.]

entries.meaning: By restriction, a food composed of a dough wrapper around a filling.

examples: Wherever legitimate tracks are found there's always some fresh scat, y'know, poo, flop, dumplings.
